title: Red Snapper With Tomato-olive Compote And Rice
summary: Red Snapper With Tomato-olive Compote And Rice is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course. For $3.71 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 475 calories, 41g of protein, and 13g of fat. This recipe serves 4. 6 people found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. If you have onion, capers, coarse salt and ground pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 94%. This score is great. Similar recipes include Tomato, Olive, Caper Compote, Whole Grilled Fish With Olive-Tomato Compote, and Grilled Spanish-Style Snapper with Tomato and Green Olive Salsa.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook rice according to package instructions; set aside, covered.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook rice according to package instructions; set aside, covered.
